pages.text: With light step, as if earth and its trammels had little power to restrain them, a young person in gorgeous vestments pauses at the brink of a precipice among the great heights of the world; they survey the blue distance before them - its expanse of sky rather than the prospect below.$(br)  Their act of eager walking is still indicated, though they are stationary at the given moment; their dog still moves.$(br)  The edge which opens on the

depth has no terror; it is as if angels were waiting to uphold them, if it came about that they leaped from the height.$(br)  Their countenance is full of intelligence and expectant dream. They have a flower in one hand and in the other a costly wand, from which depends over their shoulder a wallet curiously embroidered.$(br)  They are the heir of the other world on their travels through this one - all amidst the morning glory, in the keen

air.$(br)  The sun, which shines behind them, knows whence they came, whither they are going, and how they will return by another path after many days.$(br)  They are the spirit in search of experience; and if the Major Arcana is to be read as a story, then The Fool is the protagonist.$(br)  Many symbols of the Mysteries are summarized in this card.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Wildness, taking risks. Some kind of leap of faith.$(br)  Resisting authority, following your own path.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Hesitancy, caution.$(br)  Difficulty trusting your own instincts.
